   21: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------------
   22: %%% File    : node_container_SUITE.erl
   23: %%% Author  : Rickard <rickard.green@uab.ericsson.se>
   24: %%% Purpose : 
   25: %%% Created : 24 Jul 2002 by Rickard <rickard.green@uab.ericsson.se>
   26: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------------
   27: 
   28: -module(node_container_SUITE).
   29: -author('rickard.green@uab.ericsson.se').
   30: 
   31: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   32: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   33: 
   34: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   35:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   36:          node_container_refc_check/1]).
   37: 
   38: -export([term_to_binary_to_term_eq/1,
   39:          round_trip_eq/1,
   40:          cmp/1,
   41:          ref_eq/1,
   42:          node_table_gc/1,
   43:          dist_link_refc/1,
   44:          dist_monitor_refc/1,
   45:          node_controller_refc/1,
   46:          ets_refc/1,
   47:          match_spec_refc/1,
   48:          timer_refc/1,
   49:          pid_wrap/1,
   50:          port_wrap/1,
   51:          bad_nc/1,
   52:          unique_pid/1,
   53:          iter_max_procs/1,
   54:          magic_ref/1,
   55:          dist_entry_gc/1,
   56:          persistent_term/1,
   57:          huge_ref/1]).
   58: 
   59: suite() ->
   60:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   61:      {timetrap, {minutes, 12}}].
   62: 
   63: 
   64: all() -> 
   65:     [dist_entry_gc, term_to_binary_to_term_eq, round_trip_eq, cmp, ref_eq,
   66:      node_table_gc, dist_link_refc, dist_monitor_refc,
   67:      node_controller_refc, ets_refc, match_spec_refc,
   68:      timer_refc, pid_wrap, port_wrap, bad_nc,
   69:      unique_pid, iter_max_procs,
   70:      magic_ref, persistent_term, huge_ref].
   71: 
   72: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   73:     Config.
   74: 
   75: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   76:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
   77:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(node_tab_delayed_delete, -1), %% restore original value
   78:     erts_test_utils:available_internal_state(false).
   79: 
   80: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   81:     erts_test_utils:available_internal_state(true),
   82:     Config.
   83: 
   84: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   85:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   86: 
   87: %%%
   88: %%% The test cases -------------------------------------------------------------
   89: %%%
   90: 
   91: max_internal_pids_ports() ->
   92:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
   93:         8 -> (1 bsl 60) - 1;
   94:         4 -> (1 bsl 28) - 1
   95:     end.
   96: 
   97: max_pids_ports() ->
   98:     (1 bsl 64) - 1.
   99: 
  100: max_old_pids_ports() ->
  101:     (1 bsl 28) - 1.
  102: 
  103: max_internal_pid_num() ->
  104:     (1 bsl 28) - 1.
  105: 
  106: max_internal_pid_ser() ->
  107:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  108:         8 -> (1 bsl 32) - 1;
  109:         4 -> 0
  110:     end.
  111: 
  112: max_pid_num() ->
  113:     (1 bsl 32) - 1.
  114: 
  115: max_pid_ser() ->
  116:     (1 bsl 32) - 1.
  117: 
  118: max_old_pid_num() ->
  119:     (1 bsl 15) - 1.
  120: 
  121: max_old_pid_ser() ->
  122:     (1 bsl 13) - 1.
  123: 
  124: %%
  125: %% Test case: term_to_binary_to_term_eq
  126: %%
  127: %% Tests that node container terms that are converted to external format
  128: %% and back stay equal to themselves.
  129: term_to_binary_to_term_eq(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  130:     ThisNode = {node(), erlang:system_info(creation)},
  131:     % Get local node containers
  132:     LPid = self(),
  133:     LXPid = mk_pid(ThisNode, 0, max_internal_pid_ser()),
  134:     LX2Pid = mk_pid(ThisNode, max_internal_pid_num() - 4711, max_internal_pid_ser()),
  135:     LPort = hd(erlang:ports()),
  136:     LXPort = mk_port(ThisNode, 268435455),
  137:     LX2Port = mk_port(ThisNode, max_internal_pids_ports() - 4711),
  138:     LLRef = make_ref(),
  139:     LHLRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [47, 11]),
  140:     LSRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711]),
  141:     % Test local nc:s
  142:     LPid = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LPid)),
  143:     LXPid = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LXPid)),
  144:     LX2Pid = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LX2Pid)),
  145:     LPort = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LPort)),
  146:     LXPort = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LXPort)),
  147:     LX2Port = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LX2Port)),
  148:     LLRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LLRef)),
  149:     LHLRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LHLRef)),
  150:     LSRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LSRef)),
  151:     % Get remote node containers
  152:     ttbtteq_do_remote({get_nodename(), 3}),
  153:     ttbtteq_do_remote({get_nodename(), 4}),
  154:     ttbtteq_do_remote({get_nodename(), 16#adec0ded}),
  155:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  156:     ok.
  157: 
  158: ttbtteq_do_remote(RNode) ->
  159:     RPid = mk_pid(RNode, 4711, 1),
  160:     RXPid = mk_pid(RNode, 32767, 8191),
  161:     RXPid2 = mk_pid(RNode, max_pid_num(), max_pid_ser()),
  162:     RPort = mk_port(RNode, 4711),
  163:     RXPort = mk_port(RNode, 268435455),
  164:     RXPort2 = case RNode of
  165: 		  {_, C} when C < 4 ->
  166: 		      mk_port(RNode, 4711);
  167: 		  _ ->
  168: 		      mk_port(RNode, (1 bsl 51) + 4711)
  169: 	      end,
  170:     RXPort3 = mk_port(RNode, max_pids_ports()),
  171:     RLRef = mk_ref(RNode, [4711, 4711, 4711]),
  172:     RHLRef = mk_ref(RNode, [4711, 4711]),
  173:     RSRef = mk_ref(RNode, [4711]),
  174:     % Test remote nc:s
  175:     RPid = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RPid)),
  176:     RXPid = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RXPid)),
  177:     RXPid2 = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RXPid2)),
  178:     RPort = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RPort)),
  179:     RXPort = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RXPort)),
  180:     RXPort2 = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RXPort2)),
  181:     RXPort3 = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RXPort3)),
  182:     RLRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RLRef)),
  183:     RHLRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RHLRef)),
  184:     RSRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RSRef)),
  185:     ok.
  186: 
  187: 
  188: %%
  189: %% Test case: round_trip_eq
  190: %%
  191: %% Tests that node containers that are sent between nodes stay equal to themselves.
  192: round_trip_eq(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  193:     ThisNode = {node(), erlang:system_info(creation)},
  194:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  195:     Self = self(),
  196:     RPid = spawn_link(Node,
  197:                       fun () ->
  198:                               receive
  199:                                   {Self, Data} ->
  200:                                       Self ! {self(), Data}
  201:                               end
  202:                       end),
  203:     SentPid = self(),
  204:     SentXPid = mk_pid(ThisNode, 17471, max_internal_pid_ser()),
  205:     SentXPid2 = mk_pid(ThisNode, max_internal_pid_num(), max_internal_pid_ser()),
  206:     SentXPid3 = mk_pid({Node, 4711}, 4711, 17),
  207:     SentXPid4 = mk_pid({Node, 4711}, max_pid_num(), max_pid_ser()),
  208:     SentPort = hd(erlang:ports()),
  209:     SentXPort = mk_port(ThisNode, 268435451),
  210:     SentXPort2 = mk_port({Node, 4711}, (1 bsl 49) + 4711),
  211:     SentXPort2 = mk_port({Node, 4711}, (1 bsl 49) + 4711),
  212:     SentXPort3 = mk_port(ThisNode, max_internal_pids_ports()),
  213:     SentXPort4 = mk_port({Node, 4711}, max_pids_ports()),
  214:     SentLRef = make_ref(),
  215:     SentHLRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711, 17]),
  216:     SentSRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711]),
  217:     RPid ! {Self, {SentPid,
  218:                    SentXPid,
  219:                    SentXPid2,
  220:                    SentXPid3,
  221:                    SentXPid4,
  222:                    SentPort,
  223:                    SentXPort,
  224:                    SentXPort2,
  225:                    SentXPort3,
  226:                    SentXPort4,
  227:                    SentLRef,
  228:                    SentHLRef,
  229:                    SentSRef}},
  230:     receive
  231:         {RPid, {RecPid,
  232:                 RecXPid,
  233:                 RecXPid2,
  234:                 RecXPid3,
  235:                 RecXPid4,
  236:                 RecPort,
  237:                 RecXPort,
  238:                 RecXPort2,
  239:                 RecXPort3,
  240:                 RecXPort4,
  241:                 RecLRef,
  242:                 RecHLRef,
  243:                 RecSRef}} ->
  244:             stop_node(Peer, Node),
  245:             SentPid = RecPid,
  246:             SentXPid = RecXPid,
  247:             SentXPid2 = RecXPid2,
  248:             SentXPid3 = RecXPid3,
  249:             SentXPid4 = RecXPid4,
  250:             SentPort = RecPort,
  251:             SentXPort = RecXPort,
  252:             SentXPort2 = RecXPort2,
  253:             SentXPort3 = RecXPort3,
  254:             SentXPort4 = RecXPort4,
  255:             SentLRef = RecLRef,
  256:             SentHLRef = RecHLRef,
  257:             SentSRef = RecSRef,
  258:             nc_refc_check(node()),
  259:             ok
  260:     end.
  261: 
  262: 
  263: 
  264: %%
  265: %% Test case: cmp
  266: %%
  267: %% Tests that Erlang term comparison works as it should on node containers.
  268: cmp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  269: 
  270:     %% Inter type comparison ---------------------------------------------------
  271: 
  272:     %% The Erlang term order:
  273:     %% number < atom < ref < fun < port < pid < tuple < nil < cons < binary
  274:     RNode = {get_nodename(), 2},
  275: 
  276:     IRef = make_ref(),
  277:     ERef = mk_ref({get_nodename(), 2}, [1,2,3]),
  278: 
  279:     IPid = self(),
  280:     EPid = mk_pid(RNode, 1, 2),
  281: 
  282:     IPort = hd(erlang:ports()),
  283:     EPort = mk_port(RNode, 1),
  284: 
  285:     %% Test pids ----------------------------------------------------
  286:     true = 1 < IPid,
  287:     true = 1.3 < IPid,
  288:     true = (1 bsl 64) < IPid,
  289:     true = an_atom < IPid,
  290:     true = IRef < IPid,
  291:     true = ERef < IPid,
  292:     true = fun () -> a_fun end < IPid,
  293:     true = IPort < IPid,
  294:     true = EPort < IPid,
  295:     true = IPid < {a, tuple},
  296:     true = IPid < [],
  297:     true = IPid < [a|cons],
  298:     true = IPid < <<"a binary">>,
  299: 
  300:     true = 1 < EPid,
  301:     true = 1.3 < EPid,
  302:     true = (1 bsl 64) < EPid,
  303:     true = an_atom < EPid,
  304:     true = IRef < EPid,
  305:     true = ERef < EPid,
  306:     true = fun () -> a_fun end < EPid,
  307:     true = IPort < EPid,
  308:     true = EPort < EPid,
  309:     true = EPid < {a, tuple},
  310:     true = EPid < [],
  311:     true = EPid < [a|cons],
  312:     true = EPid < <<"a binary">>,
  313: 
  314:     %% Test ports --------------------------------------------------
  315:     true = 1 < IPort,
  316:     true = 1.3 < IPort,
  317:     true = (1 bsl 64) < IPort,
  318:     true = an_atom < IPort,
  319:     true = IRef < IPort,
  320:     true = ERef < IPort,
  321:     true = fun () -> a_fun end < IPort,
  322:     true = IPort < IPid,
  323:     true = IPort < EPid,
  324:     true = IPort < {a, tuple},
  325:     true = IPort < [],
  326:     true = IPort < [a|cons],
  327:     true = IPort < <<"a binary">>,
  328: 
  329:     true = 1 < EPort,
  330:     true = 1.3 < EPort,
  331:     true = (1 bsl 64) < EPort,
  332:     true = an_atom < EPort,
  333:     true = IRef < EPort,
  334:     true = ERef < EPort,
  335:     true = fun () -> a_fun end < EPort,
  336:     true = EPort < IPid,
  337:     true = EPort < EPid,
  338:     true = EPort < {a, tuple},
  339:     true = EPort < [],
  340:     true = EPort < [a|cons],
  341:     true = EPort < <<"a binary">>,
  342: 
  343:     %% Test refs ----------------------------------------------------
  344:     true = 1 < IRef,
  345:     true = 1.3 < IRef,
  346:     true = (1 bsl 64) < IRef,
  347:     true = an_atom < IRef,
  348:     true = IRef < fun () -> a_fun end,
  349:     true = IRef < IPort,
  350:     true = IRef < EPort,
  351:     true = IRef < IPid,
  352:     true = IRef < EPid,
  353:     true = IRef < {a, tuple},
  354:     true = IRef < [],
  355:     true = IRef < [a|cons],
  356:     true = IRef < <<"a binary">>,
  357: 
  358:     true = 1 < ERef,
  359:     true = 1.3 < ERef,
  360:     true = (1 bsl 64) < ERef,
  361:     true = an_atom < ERef,
  362:     true = ERef < fun () -> a_fun end,
  363:     true = ERef < IPort,
  364:     true = ERef < EPort,
  365:     true = ERef < IPid,
  366:     true = ERef < EPid,
  367:     true = ERef < {a, tuple},
  368:     true = ERef < [],
  369:     true = ERef < [a|cons],
  370:     true = ERef < <<"a binary">>,
  371: 
  372: 
  373:     %% Intra type comparison ---------------------------------------------------
  374: 
  375: 
  376:     %% Test pids ----------------------------------------------------
  377:     %%
  378:     %% Significance (most -> least):
  379:     %%   serial, number, nodename, creation
  380:     %%
  381: 
  382:     Pid = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, 1),
  383: 
  384:     true = mk_pid({a@b, 1}, 4710, 2) > Pid,
  385:     true = mk_pid({a@b, 1}, 4712, 1) > Pid,
  386:     true = mk_pid({c@b, 1}, 4711, 1) > Pid,
  387:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 3}, 4711, 1) > Pid,
  388:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, 1) =:= Pid,
  389: 
  390:     %% Test big external pids (> OTP-24)
  391:     MaxPidNum = max_old_pid_num(),
  392:     MaxPidSer = max_old_pid_ser(),
  393:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, MaxPidSer) < mk_pid({a@b, 1}, 4710, MaxPidSer+1),
  394:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, MaxPidSer) < mk_pid({a@b, 1}, 4710, (1 bsl 31)),
  395:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, MaxPidSer) < mk_pid({a@b, 1}, 4710, (1 bsl 32)-1),
  396: 
  397:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, MaxPidNum, 17) < mk_pid({a@b, 1}, MaxPidNum+1, 17),
  398:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, MaxPidNum, 17) < mk_pid({a@b, 1}, (1 bsl 31), 17),
  399:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, MaxPidNum, 17) < mk_pid({a@b, 1}, (1 bsl 32)-1, 17),
  400: 
  401:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, 17) < mk_pid({b@b, 4}, 4711, 17),
  402:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, 17) < mk_pid({b@b, (1 bsl 31)}, 4711, 17),
  403:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, 17) < mk_pid({b@b, (1 bsl 32)-1}, 4711, 17),
  404: 
  405: 
  406:     %% Test ports ---------------------------------------------------
  407:     %%
  408:     %% Significance (most -> least):
  409:     %%   nodename, creation, number 
  410:     %%
  411:     %% OBS: Comparison between ports has changed in R9. This
  412:     %%      since it wasn't stable in R8 (and eariler releases).
  413:     %%      Significance used to be: dist_slot, number,
  414:     %%      creation.
  415: 
  416:     Port = mk_port({b@b, 2}, 4711),
  417: 
  418:     true = mk_port({c@b, 1}, 4710) > Port,
  419:     true = mk_port({b@b, 3}, 4710) > Port,
  420:     true = mk_port({b@b, 2}, 4712) > Port,
  421:     true = mk_port({b@b, 2}, 4711) =:= Port,
  422: 
  423:     %% Test refs ----------------------------------------------------
  424:     %% Significance (most -> least):
  425:     %% nodename, creation, (number high, number mid), number low, 
  426:     %%
  427:     %% OBS: Comparison between refs has changed in R9. This
  428:     %%      since it wasn't stable in R8 (and eariler releases).
  429:     %%      Significance used to be: dist_slot, number,
  430:     %%      creation.
  431:     %%
  432: 
  433:     Ref = mk_ref({b@b, 2}, [4711, 4711, 4711]),
  434: 
  435:     true = mk_ref({c@b, 1}, [4710, 4710, 4710]) > Ref,
  436:     true = mk_ref({b@b, 3}, [4710, 4710, 4710]) > Ref,
  437:     true = mk_ref({b@b, 2}, [4710, 4710, 4712]) > Ref,
  438:     true = mk_ref({b@b, 2}, [4710, 4712, 4711]) > Ref,
  439:     true = mk_ref({b@b, 2}, [4712, 4711, 4711]) > Ref,
  440:     true = mk_ref({b@b, 2}, [4711, 4711, 4711]) =:= Ref,
  441: 
  442:     ok.
  443: 
  444: %%
  445: %% Test case: ref_eq
  446: %%
  447: %% Test that one word refs works
  448: ref_eq(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  449:     ThisNode = {node(), erlang:system_info(creation)},
  450:     AnotherNode = {get_nodename(),2},
  451:     LLongRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711, 0, 0]),
  452:     LHalfLongRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711, 0]),
  453:     LShortRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711]),
  454:     true = LLongRef =:= LShortRef,
  455:     true = LLongRef =:= LHalfLongRef,
  456:     true = LLongRef =:= LLongRef,
  457:     true = LHalfLongRef =:= LShortRef,
  458:     true = LHalfLongRef =:= LHalfLongRef,
  459:     true = LShortRef =:= LShortRef,
  460:     false = LShortRef == mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711, 0, 1]), % Not any more
  461:     RLongRef = mk_ref(AnotherNode, [4711, 0, 0]),
  462:     RHalfLongRef = mk_ref(AnotherNode, [4711, 0]),
  463:     RShortRef = mk_ref(AnotherNode, [4711]),
  464:     true = RLongRef =:= RShortRef,
  465:     true = RLongRef =:= RHalfLongRef,
  466:     true = RLongRef =:= RLongRef,
  467:     true = RHalfLongRef =:= RShortRef,
  468:     true = RHalfLongRef =:= RHalfLongRef,
  469:     true = RShortRef =:= RShortRef,
  470:     false = RShortRef == mk_ref(AnotherNode, [4711, 0, 1]), % Not any more
  471:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  472:     ok.
  473: 
  474: %%
  475: %% Test case: node_table_gc
  476: %%
  477: %% Tests that node tables are garbage collected.
  478: node_table_gc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  479:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  480:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(node_tab_delayed_delete, 0),
  481:     PreKnown = nodes(known),
  482:     io:format("PreKnown = ~p~n", [PreKnown]),
  483:     make_node_garbage(0, 200000, 1000, []),
  484:     receive after 1000 -> ok end, %% Wait for thread progress...
  485:     PostKnown = nodes(known),
  486:     PostAreas = erlang:system_info(allocated_areas),
  487:     io:format("PostKnown = ~p~n", [PostKnown]),
  488:     io:format("PostAreas = ~p~n", [PostAreas]),
  489:     true = length(PostKnown) =< length(PreKnown),
  490:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  491:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(node_tab_delayed_delete, -1), %% restore original value
  492:     ok.
  493: 
  494: make_node_garbage(N, L, I, Ps) when N < L ->
  495:     Self = self(),
  496:     P = spawn_link(fun () ->
  497:                            % Generate two node entries and one dist
  498:                            % entry per node name
  499:                            PL1 = make_faked_pid_list(N,
  500:                                                      I div 2,
  501:                                                      1),
  502:                            put(a, PL1),
  503:                            PL2 = make_faked_pid_list(N,
  504:                                                      I div 2,
  505:                                                      2),
  506:                            put(b, PL2),
  507:                            Self ! {self(), length(nodes(known))}
  508:                    end),
  509:     receive
  510:         {P, KnownLength} ->
  511:             true = KnownLength >= I div 2
  512:     end,
  513:     make_node_garbage(N+(I div 2)*2, L, I, [P|Ps]);
  514: make_node_garbage(_, _, _, Ps) ->
  515:     %% Cleanup garbage...
  516:     ProcIsCleanedUp
  517:     = fun (Proc) ->
  518:               undefined == erts_debug:get_internal_state({process_status,
  519:                                                           Proc})
  520:       end,
  521:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> wait_until(fun () -> ProcIsCleanedUp(P) end) end,
  522:                   Ps),
  523:     ok.
  524: 
  525: 
  526: make_faked_pid_list(Start, No, Creation) ->
  527:     make_faked_pid_list(Start, No, Creation, []).
  528: 
  529: make_faked_pid_list(_Start, 0, _Creation, Acc) ->
  530:     Acc;
  531: make_faked_pid_list(Start, No, Creation, Acc) ->
  532:     make_faked_pid_list(Start+1,
  533:                         No-1,
  534:                         Creation,
  535:                         [mk_pid({"faked_node-"
  536:                                  ++ integer_to_list(Start rem 50000)
  537:                                  ++ "@"
  538:                                  ++ atom_to_list(?MODULE),
  539:                                  Creation},
  540:                                 4711,
  541:                                 3) | Acc]).
  542: 
  543: %%
  544: %% Test case: dist_link_refc
  545: %%
  546: %% Tests that external reference counts are incremented and decremented
  547: %% as they should for distributed links
  548: dist_link_refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  549:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  550:     RP = spawn_execer(Node),
  551:     LP = spawn_link_execer(node()),
  552:     true = sync_exec(RP, fun () -> link(LP) end),
  553:     wait_until(fun () ->
  554:                        {links, Links} = process_info(LP, links),
  555:                        lists:member(RP, Links)
  556:                end),
  557:     NodeCre = sync_exec(RP, fun() -> erlang:system_info(creation) end),
  558:     1 = reference_type_count(
  559:           link,
  560:           refering_entity_id({process, LP},
  561:                              get_node_references({Node, NodeCre}))),
  562:     exec(RP, fun() -> exit(normal) end),
  563:     wait_until(fun () ->
  564:                        {links, Links} = process_info(LP, links),
  565:                        not lists:member(RP, Links)
  566:                end),
  567:     0 = reference_type_count(
  568:           link,
  569:           refering_entity_id({process, LP},
  570:                              get_node_references({Node, NodeCre}))),
  571:     exit(LP, normal),
  572:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
  573:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  574:     ok.
  575: 
  576: 
  577: %%
  578: %% Test case: dist_monitor_refc
  579: %%
  580: %% Tests that external reference counts are incremented and decremented
  581: %% as they should for distributed monitors
  582: dist_monitor_refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  583:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  584:     RP = spawn_execer(Node),
  585:     LP = spawn_link_execer(node()),
  586:     RMon = sync_exec(RP, fun () -> erlang:monitor(process, LP) end),
  587:     true = is_reference(RMon),
  588:     LMon = sync_exec(LP, fun () -> erlang:monitor(process, RP) end),
  589:     true = is_reference(LMon),
  590:     NodeCre = sync_exec(RP, fun() -> erlang:system_info(creation) end),
  591:     wait_until(fun () ->
  592:                        {monitored_by, MonBy}
  593:                        = process_info(LP, monitored_by),
  594:                        {monitors, Mon}
  595:                        = process_info(LP, monitors),
  596:                        (lists:member(RP, MonBy)
  597:                         and lists:member({process,RP}, Mon))
  598:                end),
  599:     3 = reference_type_count(
  600:           monitor,
  601:           refering_entity_id({process, LP},
  602:                              get_node_references({Node, NodeCre}))),
  603:     exec(RP, fun () -> exit(normal) end),
  604:     wait_until(fun () ->
  605:                        {monitored_by, MonBy}
  606:                        = process_info(LP, monitored_by),
  607:                        {monitors, Mon}
  608:                        = process_info(LP, monitors),
  609:                        ((not lists:member(RP, MonBy))
  610:                         and (not lists:member({process,RP}, Mon)))
  611:                end),
  612:     ok = sync_exec(LP,
  613:                    fun () ->
  614:                            receive
  615:                                {'DOWN', LMon, process, _, _} ->
  616:                                    ok
  617:                            end
  618:                    end),
  619:     0 = reference_type_count(
  620:           link,
  621:           refering_entity_id({process, LP},
  622:                              get_node_references({Node, NodeCre}))),
  623:     exit(LP, normal),
  624:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
  625:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  626:     ok.
  627: 
  628: 
  629: %%
  630: %% Test case: node_controller_refc
  631: %%
  632: %% Tests that external reference counts are incremented and decremented
  633: %% as they should for entities controlling a connections.
  634: node_controller_refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  635:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  636:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(node_tab_delayed_delete, 0),
  637:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  638:     true = lists:member(Node, nodes()),
  639:     1 = reference_type_count(control, get_dist_references(Node)),
  640:     P = spawn_link_execer(node()),
  641:     Node
  642:     = sync_exec(P,
  643:                 fun () ->
  644:                         put(remote_net_kernel,
  645:                             rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[net_kernel])),
  646:                         node(get(remote_net_kernel))
  647:                 end),
  648:     Creation = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [creation]),
  649:     monitor_node(Node,true),
  650:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
  651:     receive {nodedown, Node} -> ok end,
  652:     DistRefs = get_dist_references(Node),
  653:     true = reference_type_count(node, DistRefs) > 0,
  654:     0 = reference_type_count(control, DistRefs),
  655:     % Get rid of all references to Node
  656:     exec(P, fun () -> exit(normal) end),
  657:     wait_until(fun () -> not is_process_alive(P) end),
  658:     lists:foreach(fun (Proc) -> garbage_collect(Proc) end, processes()),
  659:     false = get_node_references({Node,Creation}),
  660:     wait_until(fun () ->
  661:                        case get_dist_references(Node) of
  662:                            false ->
  663:                                true;
  664:                            [{{system,thread_progress_delete_timer},
  665:                              [{system,1}]}] ->
  666:                                false;
  667:                            Other ->
  668:                                ct:fail(Other)
  669:                        end
  670:                end),
  671:     false = lists:member(Node, nodes(known)),
  672:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  673:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(node_tab_delayed_delete, -1), %% restore original value
  674:     ok.
  675: 
  676: %%
  677: %% Test case: ets_refc
  678: %%
  679: %% Tests that external reference counts are incremented and decremented
  680: %% as they should for data stored in ets tables.
  681: ets_refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  682:     RNode = {get_nodename(), 1},
  683:     RPid = mk_pid(RNode, 4711, 2),
  684:     RPort = mk_port(RNode, 4711),
  685:     RRef = mk_ref(RNode, [4711, 47, 11]),
  686:     Tab = ets:new(ets_refc, []),
  687:     0 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  688:     true = ets:insert(Tab, [{a, self()},
  689:                             {b, RPid},
  690:                             {c, hd(erlang:ports())},
  691:                             {d, RPort},
  692:                             {e, make_ref()}]),
  693:     2 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  694:     true = ets:insert(Tab, {f, RRef}),
  695:     3 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  696:     true = ets:delete(Tab, d),
  697:     2 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  698:     true = ets:delete_all_objects(Tab),
  699:     0 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  700:     true = ets:insert(Tab, [{b, RPid}, {e, make_ref()}]),
  701:     1 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  702:     true = ets:delete(Tab),
  703:     0 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  704:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  705:     ok.
  706: 
  707: %%
  708: %% Test case: match_spec_refc
  709: %%
  710: %% Tests that external reference counts are incremented and decremented
  711: %% as they should for data stored in match specifications.
  712: match_spec_refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  713:     RNode = {get_nodename(), 1},
  714:     RPid = mk_pid(RNode, 4711, 2),
  715:     RPort = mk_port(RNode, 4711),
  716:     RRef = mk_ref(RNode, [4711, 47, 11]),
  717:     ok = do_match_spec_test(RNode, RPid, RPort, RRef),
  718:     garbage_collect(),
  719:     NodeRefs = get_node_references(RNode),
  720:     0 = reference_type_count(binary, NodeRefs),
  721:     0 = reference_type_count(ets, NodeRefs),
  722:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  723:     ok.
  724: 
  725: do_match_spec_test(RNode, RPid, RPort, RRef) ->
  726:     Tab = ets:new(match_spec_refc, []),
  727:     true = ets:insert(Tab, [{a, RPid, RPort, RRef},
  728:                             {b, self(), RPort, RRef},
  729:                             {c, RPid, RPort, make_ref()},
  730:                             {d, RPid, RPort, RRef}]),
  731:     {M1, C1} = ets:select(Tab, [{{'$1',RPid,RPort,RRef},[],['$1']}], 1),
  732:     NodeRefs = get_node_references(RNode),
  733:     3 = reference_type_count(binary, NodeRefs),
  734:     10 = reference_type_count(ets, NodeRefs),
  735:     {M2, C2} = ets:select(C1),
  736:     '$end_of_table' = ets:select(C2),
  737:     ets:delete(Tab),
  738:     [a,d] = lists:sort(M1++M2),
  739:     ok.
  740: 
  741: 
  742: %%
  743: %% Test case: ets_refc
  744: %%
  745: %% Tests that external reference counts are incremented and decremented
  746: %% as they should for data stored in bif timers.
  747: timer_refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  748:     RNode = {get_nodename(), 1},
  749:     RPid = mk_pid(RNode, 4711, 2),
  750:     RPort = mk_port(RNode, 4711),
  751:     RRef = mk_ref(RNode, [4711, 47, 11]),
  752:     0 = reference_type_count(timer, get_node_references(RNode)),
  753:     Pid = spawn(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
  754:     erlang:start_timer(10000, Pid, {RPid, RPort, RRef}),
  755:     3 = reference_type_count(timer, get_node_references(RNode)),
  756:     exit(Pid, kill),
  757:     Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
  758:     receive {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, _} -> ok end,
  759:     0 = reference_type_count(timer, get_node_references(RNode)),
  760:     erlang:send_after(500, Pid, {timer, RPid, RPort, RRef}),
  761:     0 = reference_type_count(timer, get_node_references(RNode)),
  762:     erlang:send_after(500, self(), {timer, RPid, RPort, RRef}),
  763:     erlang:send_after(400, bananfluga, {timer, RPid, RPort, RRef}),
  764:     6 = reference_type_count(timer, get_node_references(RNode)),
  765:     receive {timer, RPid, RPort, RRef} -> ok end,
  766:     0 = reference_type_count(timer, get_node_references(RNode)),
  767:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  768:     ok.
  769: 
  770: pid_wrap(Config) when is_list(Config) -> pp_wrap(pid).
  771: 
  772: port_wrap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  773:     case os:type() of
  774:         {unix, _} ->
  775:             pp_wrap(port);
  776:         _ ->
  777:             {skip, "Only run on unix"}
  778:     end.
  779: 
  780: get_next_id(pid) ->
  781:     erts_debug:get_internal_state(next_pid);
  782: get_next_id(port) ->
  783:     erts_debug:get_internal_state(next_port).
  784: 
  785: set_next_id(pid, N) ->
  786:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(next_pid, N);
  787: set_next_id(port, N) ->
  788:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(next_port, N).
  789: 
  790: pp_wrap(What) ->
  791:     N = set_high_pp_next(What),
  792:     Cre = N + 100,
  793:     io:format("no creations = ~p~n", [Cre]),
  794:     PreCre = get_next_id(What),
  795:     io:format("pre creations = ~p~n", [PreCre]),
  796:     true = is_integer(PreCre),
  797:     do_pp_creations(What, Cre),
  798:     PostCre = get_next_id(What),
  799:     io:format("post creations = ~p~n", [PostCre]),
  800:     true = is_integer(PostCre),
  801:     true = PreCre > PostCre,
  802:     Now = set_next_id(What, max_internal_pids_ports() div 2),
  803:     io:format("reset to = ~p~n", [Now]),
  804:     true = is_integer(Now),
  805:     ok.
  806: 
  807: set_high_pp_next(What) ->
  808:     set_high_pp_next(What, max_internal_pids_ports()-1).
  809: 
  810: set_high_pp_next(What, N) ->
  811:     M = set_next_id(What, N),
  812:     true = is_integer(M),
  813:     case {M >= N, M =< max_internal_pids_ports()} of
  814:         {true, true} ->
  815:             max_internal_pids_ports() - M + 1;
  816:         _ ->
  817:             set_high_pp_next(What, N - 100)
  818:     end.
  819: 
  820: do_pp_creations(_What, N) when is_integer(N), N =< 0 ->
  821:     done;
  822: do_pp_creations(pid, N) when is_integer(N) ->
  823:     %% Create new pid and make sure it works...
  824:     Me = self(),
  825:     Ref = make_ref(),
  826:     Pid = spawn_link(fun () ->
  827:                              receive
  828:                                  Ref ->
  829:                                      Me ! Ref
  830:                              end
  831:                      end),
  832:     Pid ! Ref,
  833:     receive
  834:         Ref ->
  835:             do_pp_creations(pid, N - 1)
  836:     end;
  837: do_pp_creations(port, N) when is_integer(N) ->
  838:     %% Create new port and make sure it works...
  839:     "hej" = os:cmd("echo hej") -- "\n",
  840:     do_pp_creations(port, N - 1).
  841: 
  842: bad_nc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  843:     % Make sure emulator don't crash on bad node containers...
  844:     ThisNode = {node(), erlang:system_info(creation)},
  845:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_pid, _}}
  846:     = (catch mk_pid(ThisNode, max_internal_pid_num() + 1, 17)),
  847:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_pid, _}}
  848:     = (catch mk_pid(ThisNode, 4711, max_internal_pid_ser() + 1)),
  849:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_port, _}}
  850:     = (catch mk_port(ThisNode, max_internal_pids_ports() + 1)),
  851:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_ref, _}}
  852:     = (catch mk_ref(ThisNode,[(1 bsl 18), 4711, 4711])),
  853:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_ref, _}}
  854:     = (catch mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711, 4711, 4711, 4711, 4711, 4711, 4711])),
  855:     RemNode = {x@y, 2},
  856:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_pid, _}}
  857:     = (catch mk_pid(RemNode, max_pid_num() + 1, 17)),
  858:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_pid, _}}
  859:     = (catch mk_pid(RemNode, 4711, max_pid_ser() + 1)),
  860:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_port, _}}
  861:     = (catch mk_port(RemNode, max_pids_ports() + 1)),
  862:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_ref, _}}
  863:     = (catch mk_ref(RemNode, [(1 bsl 18), 4711, 4711])),
  864:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_ref, _}}
  865:     = (catch mk_ref(RemNode, [4711, 4711, 4711, 4711, 4711, 4711, 4711])),
  866:     BadNode = {x@y, bad_creation},
  867:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_pid, _}}
  868:     = (catch mk_pid(BadNode, 4711, 17)),
  869:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_port, _}}
  870:     = (catch mk_port(BadNode, 4711)),
  871:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_ref, _}}
  872:     = (catch mk_ref(BadNode, [4711, 4711, 17])),
  873: 
  874: 
  875:     %% OTP 24:
  876:     mk_port({x@y, 4}, max_old_pids_ports() + 1),
  877:     mk_port({x@y, 4}, max_pids_ports()),
  878: 
  879:     %% OTP 24: External pids can use 32+32 bits
  880:     mk_pid(RemNode, max_old_pid_num() + 1, max_old_pid_ser()),
  881:     mk_pid(RemNode, (1 bsl 32)-1, max_old_pid_ser()),
  882:     mk_pid(RemNode, max_old_pid_num(), max_old_pid_ser() + 1),
  883:     mk_pid(RemNode, max_old_pid_num(), (1 bsl 32)-1),
  884:     mk_pid(RemNode, max_pid_num(), max_pid_ser()),
  885:     ok.
  886: 
  887: 
  888: 
  889: -define(NO_PIDS, 1000000).
  890: 
  891: unique_pid(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  892:     case catch erlang:system_info(modified_timing_level) of
  893:         Level when is_integer(Level) ->
  894:             {skip,
  895:              "Modified timing (level " ++ integer_to_list(Level)
  896:              ++ ") is enabled. spawn() is too slow for this "
  897:              " test when modified timing is enabled."};
  898:         _ ->
  899:             ?NO_PIDS = length(lists:usort(mkpidlist(?NO_PIDS, []))),
  900:             ok
  901:     end.
  902: 
  903: mkpidlist(0, Ps) -> Ps;
  904: mkpidlist(N, Ps) -> mkpidlist(N-1, [spawn(fun () -> ok end)|Ps]).
  905: 
  906: 
  907: iter_max_procs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  908:     %% Disable logging to avoid "Too many processes" log which can
  909:     %% cause ct_logs to crash when trying to spawn "async print job".
  910:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+P", "2048", "-kernel", "logger_level", "none"]),
  911:     NoMoreTests = make_ref(),
  912: 
  913:     Self = self(),
  914:     NcData = make_ref(),
  915: 
  916:     %% Sleep to give all `peer` processes time to go down.
  917:     ct:sleep(500),
  918: 
  919:     RPid = spawn_link(Node, fun () ->
  920:                                    erlang:send_after(10000, self(), NoMoreTests),
  921:                                    R = chk_max_proc_line(),
  922:                                    R = chk_max_proc_line(),
  923:                                    done = chk_max_proc_line_until(NoMoreTests, R),
  924:                                    Self ! {NcData, R}
  925:                             end),
  926:     Res = receive
  927:               {NcData, R} -> R
  928:           end,
  929:     unlink(RPid),
  930:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
  931:     Cmt = io_lib:format("max processes = ~p; "
  932:                         "process line length = ~p",
  933:                         [element(2, Res), element(1, Res)]),
  934:     {comment, lists:flatten(Cmt)}.
  935: 
  936: max_proc_line(Root, Parent, N) ->
  937:     Me = self(),
  938:     case catch spawn_link(fun () -> max_proc_line(Root, Me, N+1) end) of
  939:         {'EXIT', {system_limit, _}} when Root /= self() ->
  940:             Root ! {proc_line_length, N, self()},
  941:             receive remove_proc_line -> Parent ! {exiting, Me} end;
  942:         P when is_pid(P), Root =/= self() ->
  943:             receive {exiting, P} -> Parent ! {exiting, Me} end;
  944:         P when is_pid(P) ->
  945:             P;
  946:         Unexpected ->
  947:             exit({unexpected_spawn_result, Unexpected})
  948:     end.
  949: 
  950: chk_max_proc_line() ->
  951:     Child = max_proc_line(self(), self(), 0),
  952:     receive
  953:         {proc_line_length, PLL, End} ->
  954:             PC = erlang:system_info(process_count),
  955:             LP = length(processes()),
  956:             io:format("proc line length = ~p; "
  957:                       "process count = ~p; "
  958:                       "length processes = ~p~n",
  959:                       [PLL, PC, LP]),
  960:                   End ! remove_proc_line,
  961:                   PC = LP,
  962:                   receive {exiting, Child} -> ok end,
  963:                   {PLL, PC}
  964:     end.
  965: 
  966: chk_max_proc_line_until(NoMoreTests, Res) ->
  967:     receive
  968:         NoMoreTests ->
  969:             done
  970:     after 0 ->
  971:               ?assertEqual(Res, chk_max_proc_line()),
  972:               chk_max_proc_line_until(NoMoreTests, Res)
  973:     end.
  974: 
  975: magic_ref(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  976:     {MRef0, Addr0} = erts_debug:set_internal_state(make, magic_ref),
  977:     true = is_reference(MRef0),
  978:     {Addr0, 1, true} = erts_debug:get_internal_state({magic_ref,MRef0}),
  979:     MRef1 = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(MRef0)),
  980:     {Addr0, 2, true} = erts_debug:get_internal_state({magic_ref,MRef1}),
  981:     MRef0 = MRef1,
  982:     Me = self(),
  983:     {Pid, Mon} = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  984:                                    receive
  985:                                        {Me, MRef} ->
  986:                                            Me ! {self(), erts_debug:get_internal_state({magic_ref,MRef})}
  987:                                    end
  988:                            end,
  989:                            [link, monitor]),
  990:     Pid ! {self(), MRef0},
  991:     receive
  992:         {Pid, Info} ->
  993:             {Addr0, 3, true} = Info
  994:     end,
  995:     receive
  996:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, _} ->
  997:             ok
  998:     end,
  999:     MaxTime = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond) + 1000,
 1000:     %% The DOWN signal is sent before heap is cleaned up,
 1001:     %% so we might need to wait some time after the DOWN
 1002:     %% signal has been received before the heap actually
 1003:     %% has been cleaned up...
 1004:     wait_until(fun () ->
 1005:                        case erts_debug:get_internal_state({magic_ref,MRef0}) of
 1006:                            {Addr0, 2, true} ->
 1007:                                true;
 1008:                            {Addr0, 3, true} ->
 1009:                                true = MaxTime >= erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
 1010:                                false;
 1011:                            Error ->
 1012:                                ct:fail(Error)
 1013:                        end
 1014:                end),
 1015:     id(MRef0),
 1016:     id(MRef1),
 1017:     MRefExt = term_to_binary(erts_debug:set_internal_state(make, magic_ref)),
 1018:     garbage_collect(),
 1019:     {MRef2, _Addr2} = binary_to_term(MRefExt),
 1020:     true = is_reference(MRef2),
 1021:     true = erts_debug:get_internal_state({magic_ref,MRef2}),
 1022:     ok.
 1023: 
 1024: persistent_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1025:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1026:     Self = self(),
 1027:     NcData = make_ref(),
 1028:     RPid = spawn_link(Node,
 1029:                       fun () ->
 1030:                               Self ! {NcData, self(), hd(erlang:ports()), erlang:make_ref()}
 1031:                       end),
 1032:     Data = receive
 1033:                {NcData, RPid, RPort, RRef} ->
 1034:                    {RPid, RPort, RRef}
 1035:            end,
 1036:     unlink(RPid),
 1037:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 1038:     Stuff = lists:foldl(fun (N, Acc) ->
 1039:                                 persistent_term:put({?MODULE, N}, Data),
 1040:                                 persistent_term:erase({?MODULE, N-1}),
 1041:                                 node_container_refc_check(node()),
 1042:                                 Data = persistent_term:get({?MODULE, N}),
 1043:                                 try
 1044:                                     persistent_term:get({?MODULE, N-1})
 1045:                                 catch
 1046:                                     error:badarg ->
 1047:                                         ok
 1048:                                 end,
 1049:                                 case N rem 4 of
 1050:                                     0 -> [persistent_term:get({?MODULE, N})|Acc];
 1051:                                     _ -> Acc
 1052:                                 end
 1053:                         end,
 1054:                         [],
 1055:                         lists:seq(1, 100)),
 1056:     persistent_term:erase({?MODULE, 100}),
 1057:     receive after 2000 -> ok end, %% give literal gc some time to run...
 1058:     node_container_refc_check(node()),
 1059:     id(Stuff),
 1060:     ok.
 1061: 
 1062: 
 1063: lost_pending_connection(Node) ->
 1064:     _ = (catch erts_internal:new_connection(Node)),
 1065:     ok.
 1066: 
 1067: dist_entry_gc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1068:     Me = self(),
 1069:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+zdntgc", "0"]),
 1070:     P = spawn_link(Node,
 1071:                    fun () ->
 1072:                            LostNode = list_to_atom("lost_pending_connection@" ++ hostname()),
 1073:                            lost_pending_connection(LostNode),
 1074:                            garbage_collect(), %% Could crash...
 1075:                            Me ! {self(), ok}
 1076:                    end),
 1077:     receive
 1078:         {P, ok} -> ok
 1079:     end,
 1080:     unlink(P),
 1081:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 1082:     ok.
 1083: 
 1084: huge_ref(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1085:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1086:     HRef = mk_ref({Node, 4711}, [4711, 705676, 3456, 1000000, 3456]),
 1087:     io:format("HRef=~p~n", [HRef]),
 1088:     HRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(HRef)),
 1089:     HRef = erpc:call(Node, fun () -> HRef end),
 1090:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1091:     ok.
 1092: 
 1093: %%
 1094: %% -- Internal utils ---------------------------------------------------------
 1095: %%
 1096: 
 1097: id(X) ->
 1098:     X.
 1099: 
 1100: -define(ND_REFS, erts_debug:get_internal_state(node_and_dist_references)).
 1101: 
 1102: node_container_refc_check(Node) when is_atom(Node) ->
 1103:     AIS = erts_test_utils:available_internal_state(true),
 1104:     nc_refc_check(Node),
 1105:     erts_test_utils:available_internal_state(AIS).
 1106: 
 1107: nc_refc_check(Node) when is_atom(Node) ->
 1108:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1109:     Self = self(),
 1110:     io:format("Starting reference count check of node ~w~n", [Node]),
 1111:     Pid = spawn_link(
 1112:             Node,
 1113:             fun () ->
 1114:                     erts_test_utils:check_node_dist(
 1115:                       fun (ErrMsg) ->
 1116:                               Self ! {Ref, ErrMsg, failed},
 1117:                               exit(normal)
 1118:                       end),
 1119:                     Self ! {Ref, succeeded}
 1120:             end),
 1121:     receive
 1122:         {Ref, ErrorMsg, failed} ->
 1123:             io:format("~s~n", [ErrorMsg]),
 1124:             ct:fail(reference_count_check_failed);
 1125:         {Ref, succeeded} ->
 1126:             io:format("Reference count check of node ~w succeeded!~n", [Node]),
 1127:             unlink(Pid),
 1128:             ok
 1129:     end.
 1130: 
 1131: get_node_references({NodeName, Creation} = Node) when is_atom(NodeName),
 1132:                                                       is_integer(Creation) ->
 1133:     {{node_references, NodeRefs},
 1134:      {dist_references, DistRefs}} = ?ND_REFS,
 1135:     erts_test_utils:check_node_dist(
 1136:       fun (ErrMsg) ->
 1137:               io:format("~s", [ErrMsg]),
 1138:               ct:fail(reference_count_check_failed)
 1139:       end,
 1140:       NodeRefs, DistRefs),
 1141:     find_references(Node, NodeRefs).
 1142: 
 1143: get_dist_references(NodeName) when is_atom(NodeName) ->
 1144:     {{node_references, NodeRefs},
 1145:      {dist_references, DistRefs}} = ?ND_REFS,
 1146:     erts_test_utils:check_node_dist(fun (ErrMsg) ->
 1147:                                             io:format("~s", [ErrMsg]),
 1148:                                             ct:fail(reference_count_check_failed)
 1149:                                     end,
 1150:                                     NodeRefs, DistRefs),
 1151:     find_references(NodeName, DistRefs).
 1152: 
 1153: find_references(N, NRefList) ->
 1154:     case lists:keysearch(N, 1, NRefList) of
 1155:         {value, {N, _, ReferrersList}} -> ReferrersList;
 1156:         _ -> false
 1157:     end.
 1158: 
 1159: %% Currently unused
 1160: % refering_entity_type(RefererType, ReferingEntities) ->
 1161: %     lists:filter(fun ({{RT, _}, _}) when RT == RefererType ->
 1162: % 			 true;
 1163: % 		     (_) ->
 1164: % 			 false
 1165: % 		 end,
 1166: % 		 ReferingEntities).
 1167: 
 1168: refering_entity_id(ReferingEntityId, [{ReferingEntityId,_} = ReferingEntity
 1169:                                       | _ReferingEntities]) ->
 1170:     ReferingEntity;
 1171: refering_entity_id(ReferingEntityId, [_ | ReferingEntities]) ->
 1172:     refering_entity_id(ReferingEntityId, ReferingEntities);
 1173: refering_entity_id(_, []) ->
 1174:     false.
 1175: 
 1176: reference_type_count(_, false) ->
 1177:     0;
 1178: reference_type_count(Type, {_, _ReferenceCountList} = ReferingEntity) ->
 1179:     reference_type_count(Type, [ReferingEntity]);
 1180: reference_type_count(Type, ReferingEntities) when is_list(ReferingEntities) ->
 1181:     lists:foldl(fun ({_, ReferenceCountList}, Acc1) ->
 1182:                         lists:foldl(fun ({T, N}, Acc2) when T == Type ->
 1183:                                             N + Acc2;
 1184:                                         (_, Acc2) ->
 1185:                                             Acc2
 1186:                                     end,
 1187:                                     Acc1,
 1188:                                     ReferenceCountList)
 1189:                 end,
 1190:                 0,
 1191:                 ReferingEntities).
 1192: 
 1193: stop_node(Peer, Node) ->
 1194:     nc_refc_check(Node),
 1195:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1196: 
 1197: hostname() ->
 1198:     from($@, atom_to_list(node())).
 1199: 
 1200: from(H, [H | T]) -> T;
 1201: from(H, [_ | T]) -> from(H, T);
 1202: from(_H, []) -> [].
 1203: 
 1204: wait_until(Pred) ->
 1205:     case Pred() of
 1206:         true -> ok;
 1207:         false -> receive after 100 -> wait_until(Pred) end
 1208:     end.
 1209: 
 1210: get_nodefirstname_string() ->
 1211:     atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1212:     ++ "-"
 1213:     ++ integer_to_list(erlang:system_time(second))
 1214:     ++ "-"
 1215:     ++ integer_to_list(erlang:unique_integer([positive])).
 1216: 
 1217: get_nodename() ->
 1218:     list_to_atom(get_nodefirstname_string()
 1219:                  ++ "@"
 1220:                  ++ hostname()).
 1221: 
 1222: mk_pid({NodeName, Creation}, Number, Serial) ->
 1223:     erts_test_utils:mk_ext_pid({NodeName, Creation}, Number, Serial).
 1224: 
 1225: mk_port({NodeName, Creation}, Number) ->
 1226:     erts_test_utils:mk_ext_port({NodeName, Creation}, Number).
 1227: 
 1228: mk_ref({NodeName, Creation}, Numbers) ->
 1229:     erts_test_utils:mk_ext_ref({NodeName, Creation}, Numbers).
 1230: 
 1231: 
 1232: exec_loop() ->
 1233:     receive
 1234:         {exec_fun, Fun} when is_function(Fun) ->
 1235:             Fun();
 1236:         {sync_exec_fun, From, Fun} when is_pid(From), is_function(Fun)  ->
 1237:             From ! {sync_exec_fun_res, self(), Fun()}
 1238:     end,
 1239:     exec_loop().
 1240: 
 1241: spawn_execer(Node) ->
 1242:     spawn(Node, fun () -> exec_loop() end).
 1243: 
 1244: spawn_link_execer(Node) ->
 1245:     spawn_link(Node, fun () -> exec_loop() end).
 1246: 
 1247: exec(Pid, Fun) when is_pid(Pid), is_function(Fun) ->
 1248:     Pid ! {exec_fun, Fun}.
 1249: 
 1250: sync_exec(Pid, Fun) when is_pid(Pid), is_function(Fun) ->
 1251:     Pid ! {sync_exec_fun, self(), Fun},
 1252:     receive
 1253:         {sync_exec_fun_res, Pid, Res} ->
 1254:             Res
 1255:     end.
